posts.name: Boccalone Salumeria
posts.note: Boccalone Salumeria serves panini and cured meats are on the takeaway menu at this tiny deli in the Ferry Building. If they still sell them, you should get a Salumi Cone which is a sampling of their cured meats.

posts.name: Cockscomb
posts.note: Cockscomb is an upscale California fare served in a buzzy, 2-floor space with an open kitchen and farm-animal decor. Cockscomb's head chef is Chris Cosentino who is famous for his offal dishes.

posts.name: Ferry Building Marketplace
posts.note: The Ferry Building Marketplace has vendors that sell produce, cheese, coffee, candy, cured meats, and prepared food in this soaring, restored 1898 space. If you like charcuterie, you need to get to Boccalone Salumeria.

posts.name: Radio Africa and Kitchen
posts.note: Radio Africa and Kitchen has market-fresh Ethiopian and American dishes which they serve with beer and wine in cheerful surrounds.
